Crimes.Legal_Issue: Deportation during pending humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant lived in Canada since age three, has Canadian spouse and child, no recent criminal activity
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending resolution of humanitarian application
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Deportation would cause irreparable harm to family life
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: No public danger, responsible parental role
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, best interests of the child, humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Length of residence, family integration, lack of danger to public
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Teleconference hearing conducted for judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness and fairness in administrative decision-making
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed credible based on evidence provided
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Proof of residence, marriage certificate, birth certificate of child
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation of family relationships and residency
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Severe disruption to family life constitutes irreparable harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Lack of legal status despite deep roots in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 34(1) IRPA – overstaying temporary resident status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Supportive of applicant’s integration and familial bonds
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Balance of convenience favors applicant; backlog does not justify immediate deportation
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Test for interim stay in judicial review

Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Rehabilitation, strong family ties in Canada
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Yes, including assault and other crimes
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Stay of deportation granted despite criminal history
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – focus on immigration consequence
Crimes.Authority: Federal Court under inherent and statutory powers
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Criminal offense involving violence and theft
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use or threat of force in commission of crime
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Rehabilitation, long residence in Canada since childhood, family ties
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Conviction is final and not under appeal
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Application for stay of removal in Federal Court

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Deportation while humanitarian application is pending
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant not a citizen, has Canadian-born child, no charges since past convictions
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Irreparable harm from family separation outweighs enforcement interest
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Parental responsibilities, best interests of child, humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Teleconference hearing used for expedited review
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Birth certificate, proof of relationship, criminal record history
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Confirmed family ties and absence of recidivism
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay of execution
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Severe emotional and psychological harm from forced family separation
Crimes.Cause_Description: Pending humanitarian application and lack of legal status
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions regarding compliance with conditions
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Irregular status due to past non-compliance
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Balance of convenience favors allowing humanitarian process to conclude
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Test for interim relief in judicial review
